greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table T(n,k) by antidiagonals of exponent of largest power of k-th prime which divides n.
formula: T(n, k) = log(A060176(n, k))/log(A000040(k)) = k-th digit from right of A054841(n).
example: a(12,1) = 2 since 4 = 2^2 = p_1^2 divides 12 but 8 = 2^3 does not.
a(12,2) = 1 since 3 = p_2 divides 12 but 9 = 3^2 does not.
See also examples in A249344, which is transpose of this array.
The top-left corner of the array:
mathematica: Table[T[n-k+1, k], {n, 1, 15}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 18 2019 *)
program: (define (A249344bi row col) (let ((p (A000040 row))) (let loop ((n col) (i 0)) (cond ((not (zero? (modulo n p))) i) (else (loop (/ n p) (+ i 1)))))))
for n in range(1, 10): print([a(n - k + 1, k) for k in range(1, n + 1)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 24 2017
(PARI) a(n, k) = valuation(n, prime(k)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 24 2017
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 14 2001
ext: Erroneous example corrected and more terms computed by _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 28 2014
